column1: #Text=A with New Zealand Prime Minister hopeful
#Text=This article is part of the series
#Text=Q and A with New Zealand Prime Minister hopeful
#Text=Wikipedia , Wikinews ' sibling project , has in-depth background articles on :
#Text=John Key is the leader of the New Zealand National Party and with the New Zealand General Election this year , Wikinews ' Gabriel Pollard spoke to John Key via email .
#Text=Are you taking much notice over the polls that currently show National leading by a big margin ?

#Text=: No. National remains focussed on putting together a series of policies that will lift living standards , raise after-tax incomes and deliver better social services alongside First World infrastructure .
#Text=The polling in election year is always likely to bounce around a bit , and we take nothing fore granted .
#Text=Helen Clark is desperate for a fourth term , so I fully expect they will be spending taxpayer money with little regard for the longer term consequences .

#Text=National will remain focussed on delivering on the real issues affecting New Zealanders , like after-tax incomes which are drifting further and further behind Australia , a health system which has delivered thousands of bureaucrats , and fewer operations on a per capita basis , and an education system that does n’t fail thousands of our children .
#Text=Do you take any signs of possible outcomes in New Zealand based on the election result in Australia last year ?
#Text=I do n’t think you can take the Australian result and superimpose that on New Zealand .

#Text=For starters , we are working in an MMP environment , and we are working under a very different set of Government-designed election laws that were set up to sow confusion , deny free-speech , and curb Labour ’s critics in election year .
#Text=Nevertheless , as I travel around the country I do get the sense that people are tired of the Labour-led Government , and hungry for some new ideas and fresh thinking .
#Text=National is under no illusion as to the challenges that lie ahead , not just in terms of the election but more importantly , for the future direction of this country .
#Text=If elected , what is the first major reform you would like to undertake ?
#Text=: My top priority is to start restoring the faith of New Zealanders in New Zealand .
#Text=This is a great country with huge potential and a bright future .
#Text=I want more Kiwis to believe that their future , and their children ’s future , lies here in New Zealand , not Australia or elsewhere .
#Text=In terms of policy – I want to share more of the gains from economic growth with hardworking New Zealanders through a programme of ongoing tax cuts .
#Text=In National ’s view , the Government should spend taxpayer money with the same discipline that households do , and return the taxes that it does not need to the people who paid them .
